parameters.content:
## Build OC Login Command

This workflow gets called while providing the **tokenName** in the calling workflow. 

The workflow will find the token from the credential and will build the `oc login` statement that you can use.

### Do not change this workflow as it is a common component used by other workflows.

parameters.command: =n8n export:credentials --all --decrypted | jq -r '.[] | select(.name | contains("{{ $node["Execute Workflow Trigger"].json.tokenName }}")).data.value' | tr -d '\n'
=n8n export:credentials --all --decrypted | jq -r '.[] | select(.name | contains("{{ $node["Execute Workflow Trigger"].json.tokenName }}")).data.name' | sed "s/<token>/{{ $json.stdout }}/g"

={{ $json.ocLogin }}
oc project {{ $node["Set Token Name"].json.nameSpace }}

parameters.content:
## Example of using the common OC login

By copying and using the 3 nodes below you can quickly do an `oc login` on your target environment.
* In the `Set Token Name` you fill in the name of the credential where you stored the token. For instance check out: [GOLD_Token](https://n8n-bf5ef6-dev.apps.gold.devops.gov.bc.ca/credentials) and take note on how this credential has been set up.
* Also in the `Set Token Name` fill in the targeted namespace, that will be set after your login.
* You can verify if it works by running the 3 nodes. the stdout should show ```Logged into "https://api.gold.devops.gov.bc.ca:6443" as "system:serviceaccount:bf5ef6-tools:github-cicd" using the token provided.

You have access to the following projects and can switch between them with 'oc project <projectname>':

  * bf5ef6-dev
    bf5ef6-prod
    bf5ef6-test
    bf5ef6-tools

Using project "bf5ef6-dev".``` or something similar.
* Now you can use these 3 nodes in your workflow whenever you need to be logging in into OpenShift.

parameters.command:
={{ $json.ocLogin }}
oc project {{ $node["Set Token Name"].json.nameSpace }}

parameters.content:
## Example of using the common OC login

By copying and using the 3 nodes below you can quickly do an `oc login` on your target environment.
* In the `Set Token Name` you fill in the name of the credential where you stored the token. For instance check out: [GOLD_Token](https://n8n-bf5ef6-dev.apps.gold.devops.gov.bc.ca/credentials) and take note on how this credential has been set up.
* Also in the `Set Token Name` fill in the targeted namespace, that will be set after your login.
* You can verify if it works by running the 3 nodes. the stdout should show ```Logged into "https://api.gold.devops.gov.bc.ca:6443" as "system:serviceaccount:bf5ef6-tools:github-cicd" using the token provided.

You have access to the following projects and can switch between them with 'oc project <projectname>':

  * bf5ef6-dev
    bf5ef6-prod
    bf5ef6-test
    bf5ef6-tools

Using project "bf5ef6-dev".``` or something similar.
* Now you can use these 3 nodes in your workflow whenever you need to be logging in into OpenShift.

## The Main Workflow

This is the workflow that gets triggered and it functions as an umbrella to call all the other workflows containing the tests.

Once the tests have run, the workflow will report.

## This is for the https://github.com/BCDevOps/developer-experience Repo

Call this: https://n8n-bf5ef6-dev.apps.gold.devops.gov.bc.ca/webhook/47f12fef-d385-413f-bd13-6a06725b0207?id=
Add the id (id=100), it will copy a max of 3 labels.

Your Cloned Issue will appear in the un-reviewed column assigned to the user that was the assignee on the original issue.

# How to Use this
* Copy the 3 last actions into the end of your workflow where you want to report on an error situation
* Connect it to your error branch
* Set the right parameters and call the error report WF.

The errors will be reported by email and RocketChat.

## Incoming Parameters
* **rcChannel:** RC Channel
* **rcMessage:** RC Message
* **fromAddress:** Email From
* **toAddress:** Email To
* **textMessage:** Message Body Text
* **htmlMessage:** Message Body HTML, will supersede Text Message body
* **ccAddress:** Email cc
* **bccAddress:** email bcc
* **subJect:** Email Title

## Reporting Common Component

This component will be called whenever an error report needs to be emailed and send to RocketChat.

See this [workflow](https://n8n-bf5ef6-dev.apps.gold.devops.gov.bc.ca/workflow/14) for an example.

Key is using **Set** to set up your parameters and then call this workflow.
Use [this stub](https://n8n-bf5ef6-dev.apps.gold.devops.gov.bc.ca/workflow/16) to get started.
## Report the Error

string.name: rcMessage
textMessage

parameters.query:
INSERT INTO scale_data
SELECT sections.*, gen.*
     , CEIL(RANDOM()*100) 
  FROM GENERATE_SERIES(1, 300)     sections,
       GENERATE_SERIES(1, 900000) gen
 WHERE gen <= sections * 3000;

string.name: rcMessage
textMessage

## Report the Error

nodes.name: Set Message Params for Error Report

parameters.command:
=oc exec $(oc get pods -o name --selector role=master,cluster-name=patroni-reference) -- curl -s http://localhost:8008/switchover -XPOST -d '{"leader":"{{ $json.stdout }}"}' 
sleep 20

parameters.content:
## Changes the leader in a cluster

Executing `curl -http://localhost:8009/switchover -XPOST -d '{"candidate":"patroni-reference-0"}'` (or whichever instance is found to be the leader) on the main database pod.
`patronictl switchover` does the same in the terminal.

parameters.command: =oc exec $(oc get pods -o name --selector role=master,cluster-name=patroni-reference) -- curl -s localhost:8008/cluster | jq -r '.members[] | select(.role=="leader") | .name'

main.node: Set Message Params for Error Report

parameters.content:
## Activating the workflows with a webhook

When restarting N8N, sometimes the workflows with a webhook do not properly activate the webhook.
This workflow will do this automatically.

parameters.command: n8n audit

name: Back Up Your n8n Workflows To Github

parameters.content:
## Workflow Backups
This workflow will automatically backup your workflows to your Github account every 12 hours.

### Setup
Open Globals and update the values below
**repo.owner:** This is your Github username
**repo.name:** This is the name of your repository
**repo.path:** This is the folder to use within the repository, If it doesn't exist it will be created.

If your username was `n8n-io` and your repository was called `n8n-backups` and you wanted the workflows to go into a `workflows` folder you would set:

repo.owner - bcgov
repo.name - put
repo.path - framework

## Single Item Loop
We process each workflow item one at a time, We first check Github to see if a file exists then we merge the Github Data and the API item so we can check if the values match in the function node `isDiffOrNew` we then set a status of `same`, `different` or `new`

## Save the data
Using the switch node we work out what to do based on the previous status,  If it is the same we do nothing, If it is different we update the file in Github and if it is new we create a new file. After this is done we loop back to the Split in Batches node (OneAtAtTime) to start the process again.

parameters.command:
rm test.txt
oc logout

=oc project {{ $node["General Parameters"].json.nameSpace }}
oc scale deployment/vault-test --replicas=0
sleep 20
oc scale deployment/vault-test --replicas=1
sleep 40
oc rsh $(oc get pods -o name --selector app=vault-test) cat /vault/secrets/helloworld > test.txt

parameters.content: ## Test if Vault Client Pod is working CLAB
## Check Vault Server KLAB

parameters.command:
={{ $json.ocLogin }}
oc project {{ $node["Set Token Name1"].json.nameSpace }}

parameters.content: ## Prepare the OC Login

parameters.command: =oc login --token={{$node["Set"].json["osToken"]}}  --server={{$node["Set"].json["serverUrl"]}}

=cd /data/platform-tools/nsx-net-test

P={{$node["Set"].parameter["values"]["string"][0]["value"]}}
for N in tools dev test prod; do
  oc -n "${P}-${N}" delete all,cm,netpol,rolebindings,secrets,sa,policy -l advsol-app=nsx-net-test
done
oc process -f app.yaml -p PROJECT={{$node["Set"].parameter["values"]["string"][0]["value"]}}| oc apply -f -
oc process -f run-test.yaml -p PROJECT={{$node["Set"].parameter["values"]["string"][0]["value"]}} -p CLUSTER={{$node["Set"].parameter["values"]["string"][3]["value"]}} | oc create -f -

nodes.name: Git
nodes.notes: Get the test files from the repo.

parameters.content:
## NSX Networking Test
This is a suite of tests that will help validate all networking is working properly in a NSX cluster.

The tests will run in a product set of namespaces.

KLAB2 ce9012
EMERALD a66e79

## Set Up
You need to `Set`:
* **nameSpace** - ce9012 (KLAB2) or a66e79 (EMERALD)
* **osToken** - A Openshift Token for a service account in the targeted namespace that can run the scripts.
* **clusterName**: klab2 or emerald
* **eMail**: Email address for the report

## Git
You need a Git Credential (id and Personal Access Token) that has access to the [repo](https://github.com/bcgov-c/platform-tools).

parameters.command:
=cd /data/platform-tools/nsx-net-test
curl https://www.pixelbeat.org/scripts/ansi2html.sh --output ansi2html.sh
chmod +x ansi2html.sh
./report.sh | ./ansi2html.sh > report.html

parameters.content: ## Set Up
## Run Test Code
## Clean Up and Close
## Email Report

rm -rf platform-tools
oc logout

parameters.content:
## All the Patroni Variants Tests

This is the main starting workflow for all Patroni Tests in CLAB.
These 2 tests are currently disabled until the issues with the Crunchy operator are fixed in CLAB.

parameters.subject: N8N Server Error Found

parameters.content:
## N8N Health Check

Quick check on N8N running well.

parameters.command:
oc login --token=$CLAB_TOKEN --server=https://api.clab.devops.gov.bc.ca:6443
oc project

rm -f version.json
oc version -o json > version.json
oc logout

parameters.content: ## Get Current Kubernetes Version
## Same as before?
## Trigger Runs
## All Good, just exit

## Trigger to kick off the tests when the Kubernetes version in CLAB changes

This trigger will check the CLAB Kubernetes version once every hour 24 hours a day.
If a change is detected, it will kick off all the tests as defined in the [**Master**](https://n8n-bf5ef6-dev.apps.gold.devops.gov.bc.ca/workflow/7) workflow.

This workflow **will not be run** until we find the correct triggering mechanism.

parameters.command: cat /data/log.txt | grep error]Cypress

parameters.subject: Cypress Test Failed
parameters.text:
=The following Cypress Test in https://github.com/{{$node["Set"].json["repoOwner"]}}/{{$node["Set"].json["repoName"]}} failed: {{$node["Set"].json["workFlow"]}}
The test run can be reviewed here: {{$node["Get Workflows Runs"].json["workflow_runs"][0]["html_url"]}}

parameters.command: rm /data/log.txt

=PODNAME=$(oc get pods --namespace {{ $node["Set Token Name"].json.nameSpace }} -l "app.kubernetes.io/name=patroni,app.kubernetes.io/instance=test-patroni-instance,role=master" -o jsonpath="{.items[0].metadata.name}") 

CONTAINERPORT=$(oc get pod --namespace {{ $node["Set Token Name"].json.nameSpace }} $PODNAME -o jsonpath="{.spec.containers[0].ports[0].containerPort}")  

echo $PODNAME
echo $CONTAINERPORT

nohup oc --namespace {{ $node["Set Token Name"].parameter["values"]["string"][1]["value"] }} port-forward $PODNAME 8432:$CONTAINER_PORT > /dev/null 2>&1 & 
sleep 10
jobs

kill %1
oc logout
top -n 1 -b | grep oc | awk '{print "kill -9 "$1}' | sh

parameters.content:
## This Workflow is used to trigger any other workflow 

By simply providing the workflow ID as a query parameter to the webhook. This is used by the uptime tool to trigger a workflow.

https://n8n-bf5ef6-dev.apps.gold.devops.gov.bc.ca/webhook/start_workflow?id=1

id 	                   Name                    
1	 N8N Basic Health Check
3	 Artifactory Basic Health Check
7	 Main
12	 Vault Check
14	 Patroni CLAB Main
27	 Trigger N8N image build on Version Change
31	 Patroni CLAB (Reference)
32	 Patroni CLAB (HELM)
33	 Patroni CLAB (Crunchy)
34	 Patroni CLAB (Reference) - Switch Leader

## Build OC Login Command

This workflow gets called while providing the **tokenName** in the calling workflow. 

The workflow will find the token from the credential and will build the `oc login` statement that you can use.

### Do not change this workflow as it is a common component used by other workflows.

parameters.command: =n8n export:credentials --all --decrypted | jq -r '.[] | select(.name | contains("{{ $node["Execute Workflow Trigger"].json.tokenName }}")).data.value' | tr -d '\n'

=# Make sure there are no remaining sessions
oc logout
# Kill all hanging oc processes
top -n 1 -b | grep oc | awk '{print "kill -9 "$1}' | sh
# login
{{ $json.ocLogin }}
oc project {{ $node["Set Token Name"].json.nameSpace }}
# Clean out stopped pods and RCs
oc delete pods --field-selector=status.phase!=Running
oc delete ReplicationController --field-selector=status.replicas=0
# Logout
oc logout
# Kill all hanging oc processes
top -n 1 -b | grep oc | awk '{print "kill -9 "$1}' | sh

=nohup oc port-forward svc/patroni-reference-master 15433:5432 > /dev/null 2>&1 & 
sleep 10
jobs

oc logout
top -n 1 -b | grep oc | awk '{print "kill -9 "$1}' | sh

name: Back Up Your n8n Credentials To Github

parameters.content:
## Credentials Backups
This workflow will automatically backup your credentials to your Github account every 12 hours.

### Setup
Open Globals and update the values below
**repo.owner:** This is your Github username
**repo.name:** This is the name of your repository
**repo.path:** This is the folder to use within the repository, If it doesn't exist it will be created.

If your username was `n8n-io` and your repository was called `n8n-backups` and you wanted the workflows to go into a `workflows` folder you would set:

repo.owner - bcgov
repo.name - put
repo.path - framework

## Single Item Loop
We process each workflow item one at a time, We first check Github to see if a file exists then we merge the Github Data and the API item so we can check if the values match in the function node `isDiffOrNew` we then set a status of `same`, `different` or `new`

## Save the data
Using the switch node we work out what to do based on the previous status,  If it is the same we do nothing, If it is different we update the file in Github and if it is new we create a new file. After this is done we loop back to the Split in Batches node (OneAtAtTime) to start the process again.

parameters.query: select id,name from credentials_entity order by id;

parameters.command:
rm -f *.*
rm -f -R backups
mkdir backups
mkdir backups/credentials
n8n export:credentials --backup --output=backups/credentials/ > null
mkdir backups/workflows
n8n export:workflow --all --output=backups/workflows/ > null
=echo {{ $node.Postgres.json.name. }}.json  {{ $node.Postgres.json.id }}.json

ls -al backups/credentials
ls -al backups/workflows

=# Logout
rm storage.json
oc logout
# Kill all hanging oc processes
top -n 1 -b | grep oc | awk '{print "kill -9 "$1}' | sh

=# Make sure there are no remaining sessions
oc logout
# Kill all hanging oc processes
top -n 1 -b | grep oc | awk '{print "kill -9 "$1}' | sh
# login
{{ $json.ocLogin }}
oc project {{ $node["Set Token Name"].json.nameSpace }}
=oc get ResourceQuota storage-quota -o json > storage.json
